question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Nadine Haase's employer in 2020?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Molecular Maverick: Unraveling the Research Legacy of Nadine Haase

In the realm of molecular medicine, few researchers have left an indelible mark on the scientific community like Nadine Haase. Her groundbreaking work at the Max Delbrück Center for Molecular Medicine (MDC) has not only advanced our understanding of human biology but has also paved the way for innovative treatments and therapies. This narrative delves into the fascinating story of Nadine Haase, a brilliant researcher who dedicated her career to unraveling the mysteries of molecular medicine at the esteemed MDC. Chapter 1: The Early Years of Curiosity

Nadine Haase's fascination with the intricacies of human biology began at a young age. Growing up in a family of scientists, she was encouraged to explore the wonders of the natural world. Her parents, both biologists, nurtured her curiosity, providing her with a microscope and a steady supply of scientific literature. As she delved deeper into the world of cells and molecules, Nadine became increasingly fascinated by the complex dance of biological processes that govern human life. Chapter 2: The Pursuit of Knowledge

After completing her undergraduate degree in biochemistry, Nadine embarked on a journey to pursue her Ph.D. at the University of Berlin. Her dissertation, which focused on the regulation of gene expression, showcased her exceptional research skills and laid the foundation for her future work in molecular medicine. It was during this period that Nadine became acquainted with the Max Delbrück Center for Molecular Medicine, a renowned research institute that would soon become her professional home. Chapter 3: Joining the MDC Family

In 2005, Nadine Haase joined the Max Delbrück Center for Molecular Medicine as a postdoctoral researcher. This marked the beginning of a fruitful collaboration that would span over a decade. At the MDC, Nadine was drawn to the cutting-edge research facilities and the opportunity to work alongside some of the brightest minds in the field. Her research focus shifted towards understanding the molecular mechanisms underlying human diseases, particularly cancer and neurodegenerative disorders. Chapter 4: Unraveling the Mysteries of Molecular Medicine

Nadine's work at the MDC was characterized by her relentless pursuit of knowledge and her innovative approach to problem-solving. She was instrumental in developing novel methodologies for analyzing gene expression and identifying key regulatory elements involved in disease progression.
content.source_2: In the year 2035, the world was on the cusp of a medical revolution. Breakthroughs in genetic engineering, artificial intelligence, and nanotechnology were transforming the healthcare landscape. Amidst this sea of innovation, Nadine Haase, a brilliant and ambitious researcher, was about to embark on a journey that would change her life forever. On October 8, 2035, Nadine walked through the gates of Semnan University of Medical Sciences, a prestigious institution in the heart of Iran. She had just been appointed as a researcher at the university's cutting-edge medical facility, and she was eager to contribute to the institution's mission to push the boundaries of medical science. As she settled into her new role, Nadine quickly became an integral part of the university's research team. Her expertise in molecular biology and her passion for discovery made her a valuable asset to the institution. Over the next three years, she worked tirelessly, pouring her heart and soul into her research projects. The days turned into weeks, and the weeks turned into months. Nadine's research began to bear fruit, and she made several groundbreaking discoveries that sent shockwaves through the medical community. Her work on gene editing and regenerative medicine opened up new possibilities for the treatment of previously incurable diseases. As the months passed, Nadine's reputation grew, and she became a respected figure in the scientific community. She was invited to present her research at conferences around the world, and her papers were published in top-tier medical journals. But Nadine's time at Semnan University of Medical Sciences was not without its challenges. She faced setbacks, failures, and moments of self-doubt. There were times when she felt like giving up, but her passion for her work and her determination to make a difference kept her going. On November 3, 2038, Nadine's three-year tenure at Semnan University of Medical Sciences came to an end. As she packed up her belongings and said goodbye to her colleagues, she felt a sense of pride and accomplishment. She had achieved so much during her time at the university, and she knew that her work would have a lasting impact on the medical community. As Nadine walked out of the university gates for the last time, she looked back on her journey with a sense of nostalgia. She had grown both personally and professionally, and she was ready to take on new challenges.
